gov.va.med.srcalc.domain.model

Interface Variable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DiscreteVariable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNumericalVariable, AbstractVariable, BooleanVariable, DiscreteNumericalVariable, MultiSelectVariable, NumericalVariable, ProcedureVariable

    public interface Variable

    A model variable. Just the variable, does not store an inputted value.

    This interface exists simply to permit subtype interfaces such as DiscreteVariable. See AbstractVariable for the canonical implementation of this interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HELP_TEXT_MAX
      The maximum length of a valid help text string: 4000

      The maximum length of a valid variable key: 40

      English description of the valid key characters for readable error messages.
      static java.lang.String VALID_KEY_REGEX
      A regular expression that defines a valid variable key: "\\w*"

    • Field Detail

      • VALID_KEY_CHARACTERS

        static final java.lang.String VALID_KEY_CHARACTERS
        English description of the valid key characters for readable error messages.
        See Also:
        VALID_KEY_REGEX, Constant Field Values

      • KEY_MAX

        static final int KEY_MAX
        The maximum length of a valid variable key: 40
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALID_KEY_REGEX

        static final java.lang.String VALID_KEY_REGEX

        A regular expression that defines a valid variable key: "\\w*"

        Note that this expression permits a string of any length. Validation code should check the string length first with a length-specific error message.

        See Also:
        getKey(), Constant Field Values

      • HELP_TEXT_MAX

        static final int HELP_TEXT_MAX
        The maximum length of a valid help text string: 4000
        See Also:
        getHelpText(), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        java.lang.String getKey()
        Returns a key which should be unique among all Variables. The key will match the regular expression VALID_KEY_REGEX and be no longer than KEY_MAX characters.

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns a String suitable for display to humans. Will be no longer than DisplayNameConditions.DISPLAY_NAME_MAX and will only contain DisplayNameConditions.VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_CHARACTERS valid characters.

      • getGroup

        VariableGroup getGroup()
        Returns the VariableGroup for this Variable. Never null.

      • getHelpText

        com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.String> getHelpText()
        Returns the variable definition or help text to assist a user in understanding the variable. This is an optional field, so it is represented by an Optional object.
        Returns:
        an Optional which, if present, contains a non-empty String no longer than HELP_TEXT_MAX characters. Never null.

      • getRetriever

        ValueRetriever getRetriever()
        Returns the RetrievalEnum that is used to translate VistA retrieved values to variable keys. Multiple variables may use the same retriever.
        Returns:
        possibly null

      • accept

        void accept(VariableVisitor visitor)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Accepts the given VariableVisitor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the VariableVisitor throws an Exception
